title: Trajan but a little more unique!
content:
I was just starting a branding for a new client, I’m in the starting process and I really like the look of trajan for the logo type!

I like the look and feel of trajan but I still can’t get away from it reminding me of a movie poster! Does anyone have any other suggestions of a typeface that has a similar quality and style.

I’m not ruling out trajan because its trajan, I’m just looking to explore a few more options!

Thanks, Rob

 [‹ Overprint problem with Indesign CS3](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011045618/http:/typophile.com/node/47527 "Go to previous forum topic") [FontPool: Bold, Condensed, and wet all over ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011045618/http:/typophile.com/node/47342 "Go to next forum topic")
author: robbiefa

comments.content:
Hi Rob,  
have a look:  
 [An alternative font for Trajan Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011045618/http:/typophile.com/node/46809).  
Just make sure not to pick Aviano. Otherwise you’d give David the creeps.  
F

You could take a look at Senatus by Werner Schneider. Classic and contemporary at the same time.

Michael
Thanks guys, I’ll watch out florian!
Just chiming in quickly to say that [Schneidler Initials](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011045618/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/grouptype/schneidler-initials/) is on sale.
